title.narrative: Blanket Supplementary and Targeted Supplementary Feeding Programs

description.narrative: Following the political conflict that occurred on December 15, 2013, the humanitarian situation in most parts of South Sudan has deteriorated sharply, leading to large scale displacement and exposure to food insecurity and undernutrition. According to the IPC analysis conducted in May 2015, 3.8 million people were experiencing severe food insecurity in April and were unable to meet their food needs and are still in need of urgent humanitarian assistance.

In this WFP-funded project, Action Against Hunger will undertake the following:
Overall management and coordination
Training workers on prevention and treatment of moderate acute malnutrition (MAM)
Recruiting and training community nutrition volunteers for active case finding
Monitoring Community Nutrition Volunteer activities (such as screening for MAM, home visits, coordinating demonstrations, messaging on hygiene and nutrition, community mobilization, and share feedback and complaints with the project partners)
Ensure timely, accurate and credible information sharing of program activity
Implementing complaint and feedback mechanisms
WFP and UNICEF will assist the organization with food and technical assistance, including RUTF for OTP, guidance on healthy feeding practices, provision of anthropometric equipment (MUAC tape, for example), and treat beneficiaries for MAM. Local health authorities, including the Ministry of Health, will guide and conduct sensitization sessions on nutrition, ensure physical security, and store food when needed.
